6554649:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 54yo female here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 19.5mm RLL nodule that was solid on CT, bronchus sign was positive, PET showed SUV 5.4.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Fujifilm EB-580S scope with 19g needle and sampled stations 10R x3, 7 x3, 2R x2, 4R x3, ROSE was there and showed Malignant - adenocarcinoma at multiple stations.

then switched to Ion robot and navigated to the RLL posterior basal (B10) lesion, registration was 3.2mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing adjacent view and did tool in lesion confirmation with fluoroscopy. took 7 forceps bx, 3 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Malignant - NSCLC NOS.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

Eric Johnson md
ip attending
